results.title: Toyland revolt
results.creator_credit: Czechoslovakia Film Corporation, Documentary Film Department, Section Zlin, J Novotny, T.R. Sadek and H Tyrlova
results.brief_description: A combination of live actors and animated puppets tell the story of the revolt of the toys when an S.S. man invades a toymaker’s shop and forces the old man to flee. The toys unite in their struggle to defeat the evils of Nazism. Cast: Edvard Linkers and Jindra Laznicka.

results.title: Toyland = March of the wooden soldiers = Babes in toyland
results.creator_credit: Auerbach Film Enterprises, Gus Meins and Charles Rogers
results.brief_description: Stanley Dum and Oliver Dee are well-meaning but brainless toymakers in Toyland. They misinterpret an order from Santa Claus for 600 one foot high toy soldiers and make instead 100 six feet high soldiers. But their toy army comes in handy when the evil Barnaby and his furry Bogeymen invade Toyland. Starring Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy along with Virginia Karns, Charlotte Henry, Felix Knight, Florence Roberts, Henry Kleinbach. A musical operetta.

results.title: Toying with their future
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Margaret Pettigrew and Claire Nadon
results.brief_description: Toys are big business. This discussion takes a hard look at aspects of the toy industry and the impact that popular toys have on children. Toy manufacturers promote dolls such as GI Joe and Barbie; children’s author, Marie Louise Gay, and Vietnam veteran Dave Cline question their influence, and whether the implicit values are what we really want for our children.

results.title: Toy training
results.brief_description: Training soldiers of the Royal Engineers how to operate and maintain railway systems by means of toy trains, re-building railway bridges and operating their own railway between Army camps.

results.title: Toy story 2 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Pixar Animation Studios, Walt Disney Productions, Karen Robert Jackson, Ash Brannon and John Lasseter
results.brief_description: Sequel to Disney’s 1995 hit film “Toy story.” Woody and Buzz are still competing to be the number one toy in Andy’s room. When Andy goes to summer camp the toys have their lives thrown into chaos when Woody is ‘toynapped’ by a nasty toy collector, and ends up in a museum. Buzz Lightyear and the rest of the toys set out on a rescue mission to save their friend from becoming an exhibit. But does Woody want to leave the quiet and peaceful life he has at the museum? Featuring voices by Tom Hanks, Tim Allen and Joan Cusack.

results.title: Toy story [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Pixar Animation Studios, Ralph Guggenheim, Bonnie Arnold and John Lasseter
results.brief_description: Awarded a special Academy Award for Special Achievement, this fully animated adventure is riotous fun for kids of all ages. When a draw-stringed cowboy named Woody, his boy’s favourite toy, is replaced one birthday by the latest toy - a flashy new space-ranger named Buzz Lightyear, it sparks an outrageous tiff between toys. Accidentally whisked away from home and into the clutches of the neighbourhood bully, these two squabbling rivals must work together as a team if they are to escape. Visual wizardry, uproarious laughs and the coolest characters ever assembled transform the world’s first computer-animated feature film into an incomparable movie marvel.

results.brief_description: In his adventures, Towser - a dog of the world - encounters some challenging situations. Fortunately, he is very resourceful!
